qas.question: What does the pope give to a new Cardinal?
Who decides on the design of the item given to new Cardinals?
What does the pope give to each retiring cardinal?
What does the silver ring symbolize?
What is traditionally kissed by Athiests when greeting a cardinal?
What includes the cardinal's coat of arms?

plausible_answers.text: a modern depiction of the crucifixion of Jesus, with Mary and John to each side.

qas.question: What image did Pope John Paul II depict on the outside of the ring?

context: To symbolize <b3_0>their bond with the papacy<b3_0/>, <a1_0>the pope<a1_0/> gives each newly appointed cardinal <a0_0><b2_0>a <b4_0>gold ring<b4_0/><b2_0/><a0_0/>, which is traditionally kissed by Catholics when greeting a cardinal (as with a bishop's episcopal ring). The pope chooses the image on the outside: under Pope Benedict XVI it was <b6_0>a modern depiction of the crucifixion of Jesus, with Mary and John to each side.<b6_0/> <b5_0>The ring<b5_0/> includes the pope's coat of arms on the inside.[citation needed]
